identificationModule.briefTitle: Mechanistic Studies of Psilocybin in Headache Disorders
identificationModule.officialTitle: Mechanistic Studies of Psilocybin in Headache Disorders

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In previous clinical trial work, the investigators observed lasting reductions in headache burden after limited dosing of psilocybin. This purpose of this study is to examine potential sources for this observed effect. This study will measure brain resting state functional connectivity (fMRI), central synaptic density (SV2A PET), peripheral markers of inflammation, circadian rhythm (actigraphy), and sleep (sleep EEG) in both migraine and healthy control participants before and one week after the administration of psilocybin or an active control agent.

armGroups.label: Migraine psilocybin
armGroups.description: Migraine participants randomized to receive 10 mg psilocybin (oral)

armGroups.label: Migraine placebo
armGroups.description: Migraine participants randomized to receive 2.5 mg THC (oral)

armGroups.label: Healthy control psilocybin
armGroups.description: Healthy control participants randomized to receive 10 mg psilocybin (oral)

armGroups.label: Healthy control placebo
armGroups.description: Healthy control participants randomized to receive 2.5 mg THC

primaryOutcomes.description: Comparing initial SV2A PET between migraine and HC
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from date of randomization until the date of first PET scan, assessed up to 6 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Comparing initial RSFC between migraine and HC
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from date of randomization until the date of first MRI, assessed up to 6 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in SV2A PET after drug administration
primaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in SV2A PET after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from date of first PET scan to the date of second PET scan, assessed up to 6 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in resting state functional connectivity (RSFC) after drug administration
primaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in RSFC after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from date of first MRI to the date of second MRI, assessed up to 6 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in TNF-alpha levels after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in IL-1beta levels after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in IL-6 levels after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in CGRP levels after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in pituitary adenylate cyclase activating polypeptide (PACAP)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in PACAP levels after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in bedtime (time) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening through 14 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in get-up time (time) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening through 14 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in daily active period (via actigraphy)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in daily active period (hours) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening through 14 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in daily rest period (via actigraphy)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in daily rest period (hours) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening through 14 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in REM latency (via sleep electroencephalography)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in REM latency (minutes) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in percent REM (via sleep electroencephalography)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in percent REM (%) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in sleep efficiency (via sleep electroencephalography)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Comparing change in sleep efficiency (%) after drug between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening to 7 days after drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse events from any procedure or drug administration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: from screening through 3 months after drug administration

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in TNF-alpha during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in TNF-alpha between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in IL-1beta during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in IL-1beta between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in IL-6 during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in IL-6 between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in calcitonin gene related peptide (CGRP) during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in CGRP between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in pituitary adenylate cyclase activating polypeptide (PACAP) during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in PACAP between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in mean arterial pressure (MAP) during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in MAP (mmHg) between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in heart rate during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in heart rate (beats per minute) between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in SpO2 during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing change in SpO2 (%) between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute change in general drug effects during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing "overall," "anxiety/fear," "sleepiness/sedation," "nausea," "joy/intense happiness,""peace/harmony" between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute psychedelic effects during drug administration
otherOutcomes.description: Comparing 5-Dimensional Altered States of Consciousness scale scores (0-100; higher score being more psychedelic) between psilocybin/THC and migraine/HC
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 8 hours after drug administration

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Age 21 to 70 (inclusive)
* Migraine disease per ICHD-3 criteria (for migraine participants) OR Healthy control patient

Exclusion criterion

* Unstable medical condition or serious nervous system pathology
* Pregnant, breastfeeding, lack of adequate birth control
* Psychotic or manic disorder
* Substance abuse in the prior 3 months
* Use of classic psychedelics (e.g., psilocybin, LSD, mescaline) in the past 6 months
* Use of cannabis or other THC products in the prior 2 weeks
* Urine toxicology positive to drugs of abuse
* The use of triptans (e.g., sumatriptan) or ditans (e.g., lasmiditan) more than twice weekly on average
* Use of serotonergic preventive therapies (i.e., taken chronically; amitriptyline, fluoxetine, imipramine, cyproheptadine) in the past 6 weeks
* Use of preventive or transitional treatments that produce spikes and waning of symptom relief (e.g., botulinum toxin, calcitonin gene-related peptide system targeting antibodies, peripheral nerve or ganglion blocks, chiropractic manipulation)
* History of a bleeding disorder or are currently taking anticoagulants (e.g., warfarin, enoxaparin, dabigatran, apixaban).
* Use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs; e.g., ibuprofen, naproxen) in the 7 days before PET scan and 7 days after PET scan.
